Description: Fragment of wall of Attic pottery Droop cup; interior glazed black; exterior, from the top: black area above red band bounded by quadruple dilute lines; silhouette animal frieze, upside-down, consisting of deer (tail, rump and hind legs remaining), facing away from lion (only head missing); wide black band bounded by quadruple dilute lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 90 no. 308 pl. 67)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 428, no. B682, pl. XXVIII, pl. CCIX)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1412) (phase 3)
